title: Rehabilitation Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively informal. It began with a phone call to schedule an in-person interview. The in-person portion was with the group manager. Basic questions to gauge interest and baseline skills. Good and easy experience.
Interview Questions: How do you multitask when presented with several pressing items?

title: Rehabilitation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: 2 part interview. Interview is dead on. You get to shadow current employees to decide if you could see yourself in their shoes. Only negative is that they will tell you what you want to hear to hire you.
Interview Questions: If you went to a consumer's house and they were under the influence, what would you do?

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Community Connections
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line. Interviews with both a manager from the department where I would be working as well as with the CEO. You were offered the opportunity to shadow a Community Support specialist in the field to get a better understanding of the requirements of the job.
Interview Questions: One question was about why I would stay with the company.

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Was brought in and shadowed for entire workday (was not informed ahead of time that I would be there for entire day). Staff seemed eager to hire, as they have high burnout rate. After shadowing with CSS in the field I was brought to meet with CEO Maxine Harris. Was offered the job at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflict or anger

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: email and phone and interview and hired

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is more of a hands on interaction. You spend time with the team supervisor answering questions and telling about yourself. The next portion is a full 8hr shift of Shadowing, observing, and afterwards reporting back what you experienced. Your last interview is with the CEO and is VERY intense
Interview Questions: CEO ask tough probing, and intimidating questions

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: At the time, just interviewed with the CEO directly. No interview with supervisor under whom you'll be working. Maybe lasted 25 minutes, and was offered a position at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Potential cases with clients with mental health symptoms, asked what I would do in a situation like that.

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met with the Clinical Director and the supervisor for the team in which I applied. I then spent the remainder of the day shadowing a current staff member to get a feel for the position. At the end of the day, I met with the CEO for a final review.
Interview Questions: I was asked about previous experiences by the Clinical Director and supervisor. The CEO asked more personal and intrusive questions.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was disorganized because they asked me to do multiple interviews and meet the team before being clear on whether they were planning to make an offer. I came for the first interview, then was called the morning of the second interview/meet the team, but I declined because I had another offer and felt it's unfair to continue returning for meeting the team  without first having an offer.

title: Rehabilitation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: First there is a phone screen that covers basic questions. There are there face-to-face interviews (supervisor, director and CEO). Prior to meeting with the CEO, you are expected to shadow the team for a day.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very extensive - interviews with other directors, shadowing experience, interviews with senior leadership. I had the sense that they wanted to see me in action, that they really care about the match in values and that they were looking for high quality employees.
Interview Questions: What is your vision for this agency?

title: Community Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Prepare for a day-long interview where you "shadow" other community support specialists.  I support this approach as it does give you an idea of what the job is like.

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Community Connections (Washington, DC) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was a required all day Field visit to meet clients and see interaction and comfort level in the community following a , face to face interview with senior management and team supervisor to assess understanding of work and nature of job then there was a face to face with the  CEO to determine overall fit with the team and agency.
